column2: A significant increase in the minimum wage could negatively impact small businesses and potentially cost some workers their jobs.
column3: Higher minimum wages may lead to accelerated adoption of automation in industries with low-skilled workers.
column4: Raising the minimum wage is an imperfect solution to the systemic problem of income inequality.
column5: Addressing income inequality and exploring the idea of a guaranteed minimum income could be beneficial for society in the long term.
column6: Increasing the minimum wage may result in inflation and other negative consequences such as reduction in benefits.
